Replying to @KimMaida 2019-12-03 12:47
@KimMaida Sites which are pre-generated, so you get: - Ability to serve entirely from a CDN - Simplified DX/deployment/hosting - Better security since no servers to attack - An ecosystem of specialist tools/services to use at build/run time via JS & APIs - Reduced time to market & costs

Replying to @alanxcone 2019-12-02 11:17
@alanxcone Things like @GoHugoIO (and other static site generators) help build sites with lots of pages. In that scenario, templating and utilities make the process manageable. The term JAMstack creates a vocabulary to describe a simple static site, plus all the tools that can power it up.
